contentrichtext.text: <!--uncomment if needed ''For the current|defunct federal|provincial electoral district, see [[Queen's (electoral district)]]'' ---> '''Queen's''' was a federal [[electoral district (Canada)|electoral district]] in [[New Brunswick]], [[Canada]], that was represented in the [[Canadian House of Commons]] from 1867 to 1896. It was created by the [[British North America Act]] of 1867. It consisted of the County of Queen's. It was abolished in 1892 when it was merged into [[Sunbury—Queen's]] [[Riding (division)|riding]]. ==Members of Parliament== This riding elected the following [[Member of Parliament|Members of Parliament]]: #[[John Ferris (politician)|John Ferris]], [[Liberal Party of Canada|Liberal]] (1867–1878) #[[George Gerald King|George G. King]], Liberal (1878–1888) #[[George Frederick Baird|George F. Baird]], [[Conservative Party of Canada (historical)|Conservative]] (1888–1891) #George G. King, Liberal (1891–1892) #George F. Baird, Conservative (1892–1896) ==Election results== {{Canadian election result/top|CA|1867}} {{CANelec|CA|Liberal|[[John Ferris (politician)|John Ferris]] |acclaimed}} {{end}} {{Canadian election result/top|CA|1872}} {{CANelec|CA|Liberal|[[John Ferris (politician)|John Ferris]] |acclaimed}} {{end}} {{Canadian election result/top|CA|1874}} {{CANelec|CA|Liberal|[[John Ferris (politician)|John Ferris]] |621}} {{CANelec|CA|Unknown|Amasa Coy |135}} {{CANelec|CA|Unknown|V.W. Wiggins|30}} {{end}} {{Canadian election result/top|CA|1878}} {{CANelec|CA|Liberal|[[George Gerald King]]|1,143}} {{CANelec|CA|Unknown|[[Ezekiel Stone Wiggins]] |630}} {{end}} {{Canadian election result/top|CA|1882}} {{CANelec|CA|Liberal|[[George Gerald King]] |1,084}} {{CANelec|CA|Unknown|S.L. Peters |886}} {{end}} {{Canadian election result/top|CA|1887}} {{CANelec|CA|Liberal|[[George Gerald King]] |1,191}} {{CANelec|CA|Conservative (historical)|[[George Frederick Baird]] |1,130}} {{end}} By-election: On Mr. Baird's resignation because his election was contested, 24 November 1887 {{CanElec1-by|18 January 1888}} {{CANelec|CA|Conservative (historical)|[[George Frederick Baird]] |1,175}} {{CANelec|CA|Liberal|[[George Gerald King]] |1,064}} {{end}} N.B. The Canadian Directory of Parliament states that George Frederick Baird was declared duly elected by a court decision. {{Canadian election result/top|CA|1891}} {{CANelec|CA|Liberal|[[George Gerald King]] |1,233}} {{CANelec|CA|Conservative (historical)|[[George Frederick Baird]] |1,204}} {{end}} By-election: On Mr. King being declared not duly elected, 25 February 1892, George Frederick Baird was declared elected by a court decision. {{CanElec1-by|25 February 1892}} {{CANelec|CA|Conservative (historical)|BAIRD, George Frederick |}} {{end}} == See also == * [[List of Canadian federal electoral districts]] * [[Past Canadian electoral districts]] ==External links== *[http://www2.parl.gc.ca/Sites/LOP/HFER/hfer.asp?Language=E&Search=Det&rid=586&Include= Riding history from the] [[Library of Parliament]] [[Category:Defunct New Brunswick federal electoral districts]]
